title: Campus Construction Manager
description:
Meta is seeking an experienced Campus Construction Manager to join our Data Center Engineering & Construction (DEC) Team. Our data centers are the foundation upon which our rapidly scaling infrastructure efficiently operates and upon which our innovative services are delivered. Building, operating, and retrofitting data centers the "right" way is synonymous with ensuring high uptime, capacity availability, and capital conservation. The Design, Engineering and Construction (DEC) team thinks from chip to chiller (or electrical substation), determining configurations and ensuring maximum efficiency of our infrastructure. 

The DEC Delivery team is committed to continual optimization of the delivery process at each level. The DEC Delivery organization operates in a matrixed team structure and the Delivery Campus Construction Manager will have the campus-wide responsibility for New, Retrofit, & Connectivity construction project success including responsibility to establish and maintain GC and trade partner relationships, talent development, and partner relationship management with key cross functional operational partners (Facilities Operations, Edge Network Services and Facilities Engineering to name a few) at the site in a culture of collaboration, safety and quality unparalleled in the datacenter construction industry.  

The Delivery Campus Construction Manager is responsible for leading all construction activity on the assigned campus which can be a single, double, or triple data center region. Each construction project on campus ranges from approx $1M- $5B project sizes managing a team of up to 11 direct reports and leading a team of direct reports as well as matrixed Safety, QAQC and Project Controls (Cost + Schedule) professionals at site toward predictable outcomes.

CAMPUS CONSTRUCTION MANAGER RESPONSIBILITIES 

The Campus Construction Manager reports to the Geographical Construction Manager (aka the Geo) within the DEC Delivery pillar.
Represent the Design, Engineering, & Construction (DEC) interests as the onsite leader for all new build, retrofits, and connectivity activities as well as provide accountability for work within this area of responsibility.
Represent DEC in the onsite Circle of Leadership (COL) at each campus to effectively partner with Infra Data Centers (IDC) cross functional teams.
Accountable for the management of the live environment retrofit work on campus.
Accountable for the management of major vendor (General Contractor, Cabling Partner, Trade Partner, Consultants) relationship at the campus level to include GC personnel. Development and succession and feedback signal for continuous improvement.
Accountable for the management of biweekly risk identification review process and provide reports (financial, schedule, Q/C).
Accountable for the management of CapEx and OpEx budgets for the campus.
Accountable for the management of warranty work program for existing data center buildings.
Accountable to ensure proactive risk identification and mitigation for all new build, retrofit and cable infrastructure projects at a datacenter campus as defined by predictability in: Safety, Quality, Schedule, & Cost.
Responsible for the management of onsite talent, both Full Time Employees (FTEs) and Contingent Workers (CWs). Inclusive of the recruitment, retention, and growth of onsite teams to support construction and network delivery.
Responsible for ensuring the partnership of the teams with the vendors as well as in partnership with the matrixed reports in Safety, Quality, and Project Controls (aka Cost & Schedule).
Responsible for the management of cross functional team for Owner Furnished Equipment (OFE) procurement and delivery process.
Responsible for the management of knowledge capture (aka lessons learned) and transfer at the program and campus level to ensure continuous improvement and consistency of delivery.
Partner with cross functional teams for the development of annual capital project budgets including the provision of requested ROM construction cost estimates.
Partner with cross functional teams to finalize project contract negotiations (initial and change orders) for General Contractor, cabling partner, trade partner and consultant scopes.
10% travel to headquarters and other data center campuses.
Respond on an as-needed basis to emergencies.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Civil, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering, Telecommunications, or equivalent experience.
15+ years of experience in construction management and/or equivalent experience in fiber connectivity.
Proven successful experience with ground-up, retrofit, and/or connectivity construction.
Effective knowledge of industry standards, building codes and safety standards including fire protection regulations.
Highly skilled with negotiations, capital budget management, and contract management.
Successful management experience of large construction teams inclusive of trade partner and/or general contractor management.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 

Working knowledge of data center systems including mechanical, electrical, building management system, fire protection, and network connectivity.
Working knowledge of CPM scheduling methodologies and schedule management.
Working knowledge of CapEx, OpEx, and construction cost control strategies.
Working knowledge of supply chain management including creative risk and mitigation strategies.
Proven success in matrixed organization structures.

ABOUT META

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. title: TPM Manager, Optics & Display Research, Reality Labs
description:
At RL Research, you will join a world-class team exploring cutting edge machine learning, computer vision, hardware, software, and state-of-the-art Augmented and Virtual reality technology. Every day, you will work alongside the world's leading Research Scientists, and Engineers to create the technology that will make VR and AR pervasive and universal.

For this role, RL Research is looking for an exceptional TPM Manager to join our team. If your passion and experience lies in working with multidisciplinary teams and building the right processes and methodologies for them. If you’ve had experience with complex cutting edge technology. If you thrive helping your team coordinate and collaborate in the face of ambitious and ambiguous challenges, taking on work that has never been done before. We might have a spot for you.

TPM MANAGER, OPTICS & DISPLAY RESEARCH, REALITY LABS RESPONSIBILITIES 

Directly manage a team of Technical Program Managers across the Optics & Display Research team through coaching, mentoring and training. Holding a high standard of performance both personally and for the TPM Organization.
Oversee and manage technical portfolio across the entire team.
Establish best practices and refine processes for increased flexibility, communication and adaptability among research and development teams.
Drive technical excellence within the team, coordinating and contributing to project management practices, team road maps, workflow development, launch criteria, and test plans.
Coordinate communication between numerous internal and external teams, vendors and partners.
Engage with partner and cross-functional teams to identify constraints, dependencies, and coordination areas, to deliver features at high quality.
Identify resources needed and work closely with the team leads to maintain full visibility of multiple projects, ensuring resource gaps are addressed efficiently.
Partnering with research leads and leveraging technical expertise to understand the nature of the research. Translating that into goals, roadmaps, and strategy in partnership with key team leads.
Ensuring the members of their team are able work at their highest potential and are able to play to their strengths. That conflicts (both technical and interpersonal) have paths toward resolution to allow the team to move forward.
Leverage the least amount of process to accomplish the goal. Ask, "Is there a better way?“. Evaluate retrospectives to add, adjust, and remove processes based on learnings.
Ability to travel 15%.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

10+ years experience as a technical program manager working in cross-functional hardware development.
4+ years experience managing small to medium sized teams, demonstrated experience managing both over and underperforming team members.
Track record of driving through ambiguity while being dynamic and flexible to customer feedback and changes in priority or direction.
Analytical and negotiation skills in combination with effective communication experience, can translate high-level goals into tangible action plans, and vice-versa.
Bachelor’s degree in Optics, Physics, Engineering, Program Management, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Project management, leadership, dependency management and cross-group collaboration experience (both inside and outside of an organization).
Communication/presentation experience through all levels of the organization, technical and non-technical.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 

Experience working with a cross-disciplinary team of researchers, software engineers and hardware engineers.
Experience with research and development in optics, imaging systems, hardware engineering.
Strong understanding of coaching and mentoring in a flexible environment.
Experience tracking budgets and creating reliable quarterly estimates and accruals.
Graduate degree in Optics, Physics, Engineering, Program Management, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

ABOUT META

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.
Meta is committed to providing reasonable support (called accommodations) in our recruiting processes for candidates with disabilities, long term conditions, mental health conditions or sincerely held religious beliefs, or who are neurodivergent or require pregnancy-related support. If you need support, please reach out to accommodations-ext@fb.com.
 (New York City only*) Planned salary of $253,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

 (Colorado only*) Estimated salary of $241,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

title: Campus Leader
description:
SUMMARY:

Weekly Hours: 14
Role Number:200450750
Home Office: Yes

The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.

What does this mean? You have energy, dedication, passion, and the capabilities to help Apple transform education and improve the college experience. You take every experience as a learning opportunity and improve upon your technique for the next. 

You’re not only passionate about representing the Apple brand but also very active in various student organizations and eager to plan events to enrich the lives of students, faculty, and staff.  You’re well-connected on campus and passionate about how technology can support student life in the classroom and beyond. As a natural leader, you pursue your passions and are inspired to fuel others to do the same.

KEY QUALIFICATIONS:

Availability to work between 10 to 14 hours per week for the full term from May 2023 through May 2024
Ability to work flexible hours and days, including weekends, throughout the school year
Actively enrolled and taking classes at the school listed in the job title from May 2023 through May 2024
Passion for how Apple technology can support multiple career pathways through coding or other creative outlets
Dedication to following program guidelines to protect brand integrity
Excellent communication skills—written and verbal—including the ability to communicate with a virtual team
Strong formal presentation skills
Ability to inspire a team and grow engagement by influencing, motivating, and aligning with campus contacts to achieve strategic goals
Ability to self-motivate, overcome obstacles, work independently, while consistently reporting back on the program
Excellent time-management, organization, planning, and implementation skills
Ability to adapt quickly and think creatively
High level of ethics, values, integrity, and trust
Knowledge of Apple products
Sales, leadership, and marketing experience is a plus

DESCRIPTION:

We’re looking for highly motivated students who have a real passion to learn and innovate. Being a Campus Leader takes an understanding of technology and the ability to spread the Apple message to impact the college experience. It takes someone who can encourage others, move fast, and get things done. 

In this role, you will partner with the Campus Leader Program and Account Team to tailor program initiatives to campus-specific opportunities. You will share your passion for Apple, and inspire and educate customers about all that Apple has to offer.  Our Campus Leaders exemplify Apple’s unique style of service through words and action, and maintain a flexible schedule to support business needs. 

You’re an ideal candidate if you’re comfortable planning and sharing ideas, already connected with groups and organizations at your school, and excited to expand your network even further. This is more than a college job — it’s a great opportunity to get your résumé off to an incredible start and gain experience that will last a lifetime.

PAY & BENEFITS:

At Apple, your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. This role pays between $22.00 and $29.10/hr and most new hires start at $22.00/hr. Your actual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to own shares of Apple stock, because all Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, as well as a discount when purchasing Apple stock if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive other benefits: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefits programs are subject to eligibility requirements.

description:
Software Engineer (Leadership) - Machine Learning
Facebook wordmarkFacebook
Location pin icon
Sunnyvale, CA

Apply to Job
Meta is seeking Machine Learning Engineers to join our engineering team. The ideal candidate will have industry experience working on a range of classification and optimization problems like payment fraud, click-through rate prediction, click-fraud detection, search ranking, text/sentiment classification, collaborative filtering/recommendation, or spam detection. The position will involve taking these skills and applying them to some of the most exciting and massive social data and prediction problems that exist on the web.

SOFTWARE ENGINEER (LEADERSHIP) - MACHINE LEARNING RESPONSIBIL

Drive the team's goals & technical direction to pursue opportunities that make your larger organization more efficient
Effectively communicate complex features & systems in detail
Understand industry & company-wide trends to help assess & develop new technologies
Partner & collaborate with organization leaders to help improve the level of performance of the team & organization
Identify new opportunities for the larger organization & influence the appropriate people for staffing/prioritizing these new ideas
Suggest, collect and synthesize requirements and create an effective feature roadmap
Develop highly scalable classifiers and tools leveraging machine learning, data regression, and rules-based models
Adapt standard machine learning methods to best exploit modern parallel environments (e.g. distributed clusters, multicore SMP, and GPU)

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS 

Experience leading projects with industry-wide impact
Experience communicating and working across functions to drive solutions
Experience in mentoring/influencing senior engineers across organizations
Proven track record of planning multi-year roadmap in which shorter-term projects ladder to the long-term vision
Experience in driving large cross-functional/industry-wide engineering efforts
12+ years of experience in programming languages (Python, C++, Java or R) with technical background
8+ years of experience in one or more of the following areas: machine learning, recommendation systems, pattern recognition, NLP, data mining or artificial intelligence
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 

Experience in shipping products to millions of customers or have started a new line of product
Experience with Hadoop/HBase/Pig or MapReduce/Sawzall/Bigtable/Hive/Spark

title: Specialist: Full-Time, Part-Time, and Part-Time Temporary
description:
JOB SUMMARY

Posted: Dec 26, 2022
Role Number:114438158

Do you love how it feels to help others? The Apple Store is dedicated to delivering a customer experience that’s unlike any other. As a Specialist, it starts with you discovering customers’ needs. And with the support of your store team members, you match those needs with the right products. Every day is an opportunity for you to turn another Apple Store visitor into a loyal Apple customer.

In this role, you could work full-time, part-time, or part-time temporary.

KEY QUALIFICATIONS

You have agility to learn new products and features with an interest in technology, particularly Apple products.
Ability to deliver great customer experiences in any environment and to be invigorated by constant personal interaction.
Strong communication skills that let you converse as freely and comfortably with small groups as with individual customers.

DESCRIPTION 

As a Specialist, you’ll become highly skilled at uncovering customers’ needs, then following through with meaningful solutions. Not only are you the first person customers meet when they enter the store, but you’ll be the person who guides them — advising, selling, and even setting up their new products. You perform other roles within the store too, whether it’s maintaining visual merchandising or assisting team members. Always curious, you stay on top of news about products and initiatives, ready to apply your learning in customer interactions. You’ll be provided with training to be successful. Your success is measured by team and individual productivity as well as overall store performance. You’re proud to represent Apple, and you get great satisfaction from helping customers develop lifelong relationships with Apple. 

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS 

•You're passionate about Apple and eager to share that passion with others.
•You're willing to learn and embrace the guidelines behind Apple's unique style of service.
•You have strong people skills-you're approachable, a good listener, and empathetic.
• Your work hours will be based on your availability and business needs and may vary week to week.

PAY & BENEFITS 

At Apple, your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. This role pays between $22.00 and $31.20/hr and most new hires start at $22.00/hr. Your actual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.
Apple employees also have the opportunity to own shares of Apple stock, because all Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, as well as a discount when purchasing Apple stock if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive other benefits: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

title: Commissary Kitchen Staff
description:
What job are we baking:

We are looking for a Full-Time Commissary Kitchen Staff to join our commercial kitchen in College Point, Queens! The ideal candidate will be well versed in the culinary arts with a passion for sweet and delicious creations.  Our staff produces 30,000 cookies a week so a candidate who has experience in a high-volume production kitchen is preferred. The job will require bulk scaling recipes, mixing cookie dough on heavy duty machinery, and scooping large quantities of cookies. This role will report to the Executive Pastry Chef. Shifts available: Monday - Friday, 2:00pm - 10:30pm. 



Your bakery duties:

Prepares high-volume of goods following set recipes
Quality checks raw goods, prepared goods, and commercial equipment
Monitors inventory for baking ingredients such as flour, sugar, etc. and ensure orders are placed if necessary
Maintain a clean and orderly workstation and adheres to health and safety standards with light dish washing
Provides scheduling flexibility according to business needs


Your main ingredients:

Experienced in a high-volume production facility as a Commissary Kitchen Staff or relevant role
High attention to detail and creativity
Ability to navigate a commercial kitchen, stockroom, office, and lift up to 50 lbs. several times a day, with or without reasonable accommodation
Culinary Arts education a plus!
Food Handlers Certification a plus!


Benefits:

Opportunity for career growth! Chip City is growing rapidly and opening new stores
Eligible for medical benefits after three months of employment
50% Off all cookies, beverages, and merchandise
A fully stocked employee kitchen with snacks and beverages

title: Specialist: Full-Time, Part-Time, and Part-Time Temporary
description:
JOB SUMMARY

Posted: Dec 26, 2022
Role Number:114438158

Do you love how it feels to help others? The Apple Store is dedicated to delivering a customer experience that’s unlike any other. As a Specialist, it starts with you discovering customers’ needs. And with the support of your store team members, you match those needs with the right products. Every day is an opportunity for you to turn another Apple Store visitor into a loyal Apple customer.

In this role, you could work full-time, part-time, or part-time temporary.

KEY QUALIFICATIONS

You have agility to learn new products and features with an interest in technology, particularly Apple products.
Ability to deliver great customer experiences in any environment and to be invigorated by constant personal interaction.
Strong communication skills that let you converse as freely and comfortably with small groups as with individual customers.

DESCRIPTION 

As a Specialist, you’ll become highly skilled at uncovering customers’ needs, then following through with meaningful solutions. Not only are you the first person customers meet when they enter the store, but you’ll be the person who guides them — advising, selling, and even setting up their new products. You perform other roles within the store too, whether it’s maintaining visual merchandising or assisting team members. Always curious, you stay on top of news about products and initiatives, ready to apply your learning in customer interactions. You’ll be provided with training to be successful. Your success is measured by team and individual productivity as well as overall store performance. You’re proud to represent Apple, and you get great satisfaction from helping customers develop lifelong relationships with Apple.

At Apple, your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. This role pays between $22.00 and $31.20/hr and most new hires start at $22.00/hr. Your actual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

title: Diesel Mechanic
description:
First Vehicle Services is now hiring a Diesel Mechanic for our shop serving Williamsburg, Virginia!

First things First: Who are we? 

First Vehicle Services is a leading provider of diverse fleet management and maintenance services in North America. Since 1981, First Vehicle Services has been providing efficient and cost-effective vehicle management and maintenance services at governments, school districts, petrochemical companies, transit agencies, airports, universities, and private organizations throughout the United States. 

Why join First as a Diesel Mechanic?

$28 - $30 / hour based on experience and qualifications (NOT flat-rate)
An additional $.10 per hour for each ASE certification you possess or obtain
Company-paid ASE testing and training materials
Monday - Friday 2:30 pm - 11:00 pm full-time shift schedule and consistent, year-round work
Tremendous career advancement opportunities
Benefits include medical, dental, vision, & 401(k)
Paid holidays & vacation
Annual allowances for boots and prescription safety glasses
State-of-the-art training programs
Discounts on cell phone plans, cars, and more through the Perk Spot program!
About the Diesel Mechanic Position 

As a Diesel Mechanic with First Vehicle Services, you will help maintain and repair Gillig, New Flyer, Orion transit buses, Ford, Chevy, Dodge light trucks, and vans to ensure vehicle readiness & safety. Other major job duties include:

Perform preventative maintenance (PMs), safety inspections, and annual maintenance inspections.
Diagnose and perform all phases of vehicle and equipment repair including brakes, suspensions, engines, drivetrains, transmissions, and other repairs.
Ensure work orders are completed accurately.
Assist with road calls and emergency services as necessary.
Qualifications for Diesel Mechanic

A minimum of a Class B CDL is required
Virginia State inspectors license is highly preferred
At least 3 - 5 years of automotive and diesel transit bus or heavy truck maintenance & repair employment experience or a combination of technical school education & experience.
Possess a mechanic’s tool set
ASE certifications are preferred. Must be willing to participate in the company ASE certification program (company training, testing, and bonuses provided!)
Be subject to a drug test.
Get your career on the road with First Vehicle Services! 

We aspire to have a culture where all people are First. We strive to attract and retain a diverse workforce therefore all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status. First is also committed to providing a drug-free workplace. For candidates applying to positions in San Francisco or Los Angeles California, First will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance or Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance. First is an equal opportunity employer and by doing so we will sustain and promote an inclusive culture that supports future growth for all.

description:

In this role, you could work full-time, part-time, or part-time temporary.

KEY QUALIFICATIONS

You have agility to learn new products and features with an interest in technology, particularly Apple products.
Ability to deliver great customer experiences in any environment and to be invigorated by constant personal interaction.
Strong communication skills that let you converse as freely and comfortably with small groups as with individual customers.

DESCRIPTION 

As a Specialist, you’ll become highly skilled at uncovering customers’ needs, then following through with meaningful solutions. Not only are you the first person customers meet when they enter the store, but you’ll be the person who guides them — advising, selling, and even setting up their new products. You perform other roles within the store too, whether it’s maintaining visual merchandising or assisting team members. Always curious, you stay on top of news about products and initiatives, ready to apply your learning in customer interactions. You’ll be provided with training to be successful. Your success is measured by team and individual productivity as well as overall store performance. You’re proud to represent Apple, and you get great satisfaction from helping customers develop lifelong relationships with Apple. 

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS 

•You're passionate about Apple and eager to share that passion with others.
•You're willing to learn and embrace the guidelines behind Apple's unique style of service.
•You have strong people skills-you're approachable, a good listener, and empathetic.
• Your work hours will be based on your availability and business needs and may vary week to week.

PAY & BENEFITS 

At Apple, your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. This role pays between $22.00 and $31.20/hr and most new hires start at $22.00/hr. Your actual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.
Apple employees also have the opportunity to own shares of Apple stock, because all Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, as well as a discount when purchasing Apple stock if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive other benefits: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefits programs are subject to eligibility requirements.

title: Counsel, Advertising Legal Affairs
description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 223 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen.

The Netflix Advertising Legal team is seeking a talented, passionate and experienced lawyer to support our ad supported offering.  

In this role, the successful candidate will work closely with cross functional teams, including Advertising, AdTech, Product, Business and Legal Affairs, Privacy, Public Policy and Product Legal, to perform the following functions: review and negotiate advertising related agreements (such as ad measurement and upfront agreements); advise on advertising product features; advise on ads policies; strategize and propose solutions for sticky legal challenges; and prepare and conduct trainings to help increase legal acumen across our newly formed advertising teams.  This is a great opportunity to be an integral part of our Advertising legal team to support our growing advertising offering.  This role is based in Los Angeles, CA and reports into the Head of Advertising Legal. The ideal candidate will be intellectually curious, demonstrate great initiative and be excited and inspired by the Netflix culture.

REQUIREMENTS

The successful candidate will have 4+ years of relevant experience as a lawyer working in advertising (including ad sales). Entertainment experience is a plus.
Ability to work autonomously and reliably within tight timeframes in a fast-paced, high-performance environment
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills (both oral and written)
Strong analytical capabilities and ability to exercise sound judgment in the absence of perfect information
Ability to take initiative to identify and solve problems in a business-friendly and solutions-oriented manner
Ability to think strategically, commercially and practically
Excellent organizational and time management skills with an ability to multitask, prioritize and meet deadlines
Strategic interest and outlook
High degree of professional ethics and integrity
Flexibility to work across various projects and teams

title: Project Specialist, Workplace Design
description:
Netflix is the world's leading digital entertainment service. As we expand globally, we continue to look for the best and brightest talent to help us scale. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team.
 
We are seeking a Project Specialist of Workplace Design + Brand, with interior architecture and branding design experience. The ideal candidate will have the ability to lead a creative process from its strategic start to its executional finish.  With a strong understanding of storytelling through architecture & brand, this candidate will be a part of a creative team, has the ability of being hands-on when projects demand it and will work alongside project managers to help build all physical touch points of Netflix’s brand for a fast growing real estate portfolio worldwide, within the Design & Construction team.  This candidate will have a proven track-record of creative problem solving, excellent organizational skills, strong communication skills, deep understanding of various international cultures,  as well as a rigorous attention to detail. noted below. 

RESPONSIBILITIES 

Drive creative consistency in our environments that foster creativity, innovation and to enable people to do their best work.
Manages and maintains multiple, simultaneous projects through all phases with a high level of accuracy, timeliness and follow-up with consistent and concise communication with project managers & cross functional teams, local & regional (internal) teams
Provide support through guidance, feedback, and help realize a design vision.  This vision will be provided in creative briefs for external design architects, consultants or artist agencies. 
Maintain a strong working partnership with project managers to ensure that the project scope meets budget. Collaborate and lead value engineering exercises if needed to stay within budget and schedule.
Provide design guidance for construction projects in different time-zones across various regions, as needed.  Participating in calls with project teams across multiple time zones will be required 
Ensure designs are cohesive to the overall project intent and represent Netflix’s culture and brand values.
Remains current with design knowledge, processes and philosophies, specifically around Inclusive Design, Future of Work & Resilient design strategies
If required, specify finishes, and production methods for architectural, print and branded design efforts
Review construction & architectural design details, brand-related drawings,  FFE & lighting specifications to ensure proper coordination of design intent.
Partner with planning & occupancy leads to incorporate programming needs into physical space.  Assist with workplace assessments (with the support of a space programmer) for the Portfolio and Transaction teams to enable site renewal and/or new selection
Manage programming and design changes throughout the design process.
Coordinate the completion and presentation of design phase milestones from our design partner firm to enable visibly to design progress.  

QUALIFICATIONS 

Bachelor's degree in Interior Architecture, Interior Design, or equivalent practical experience.
8-10 min years of experience in planning, design development, or project management on workplace projects. With the understanding of branding an environment and integration into the built environment.
Strong understanding of the construction and design process; expert knowledge of working drawings and procedures.
Working ability of Google Suite, Adobe Products: Creative Suite, as well as Bluebeam, CAD or Revit
Extraordinary attention to detail, while still working under strict timelines
Strong time management and organizational skills and experience managing multiple projects simultaneously.
Deep understanding of and ability to articulate how design concepts to strategy in the corporate workplace practice and how that can positively affect Netflix’s business and workplace design.
Ability to develop relationships across teams, functions, and geographies.

title: Associate, Payments Strategy, Planning, & Analysis
description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 223 paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. Visit our culture memo and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and the opportunity to be part of our team.

The Payments Strategy, Planning, & Analysis team is looking for an Associate based in Los Gatos, California that focuses on global payment processing fee strategy and payment analytics for the North America region (US and Canada). You will play an essential role in leading day-to-day efforts to monitor and drive analysis to optimize payment performance, and monitor and audit payment processing cost. You will be part of the team responsible for driving business insights from payments data, managing payment costs analytics, and ultimately supporting the
development of the Netflix payments strategy.

Netflix is growing fast with a flat organizational structure, which means that employees are often asked to perform tasks with a range of difficulties. The ideal candidate will be prepared to regularly “roll up their sleeves” to perform more mundane tasks on the same day that they present to the executives of the company.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Lead and support strategic value-added analyses to measure and forecast the impact of payment method offerings and monitor payments processing performance for the North America region.
Support credit/debit card issuers and brands (Visa/Mastercard) engagement with the payments team with a focus on improving performance.
Monitor payment cost metrics, identify trends and opportunities for cost savings with key vendors and strategic payment partners.
Conduct regular audits to ensure the payment processing fees are correctly applied per contract and ecosystem rules.
Work cross-functionally throughout the organization (e.g. payments managers, partnership and operations, PMs, data science & engineering, billing and payments engineering) to support implementation of payment solutions and payments fee negotiations, and lead the related performance measurement.
Define and develop metric dashboards for payment cost reporting and ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Create insightful presentations to facilitate decision-making for internal stakeholders and external partners.  

QUALIFICATIONS

3-5 years of work experience, ideally with some relevant payments experience
Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, economics, mathematics, statistics, or other relevant field is preferred
Curious, motivated, disciplined, and able to work autonomously.
Excellent analytical skills, including the ability to use business intelligence tools (SQL and Tableau), build spreadsheet models, and sort through complex data to crystallize business implications.
Strong project management and great collaboration skills across multiple functional areas.
Skilled at crafting a data-driven story and presenting to senior management.
Experience and comfort with a high degree of freedom and responsibility.
Able to remain highly organized in a loosely structured and fast-paced environment.

title: Marketing Director, External Games
description:
Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We connect people with movies and television globally by delivering outstanding content and technological innovation. 

This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new video game offering. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 208 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages.
Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort. 
We are looking for a talented Product Marketing Director to build our games product marketing function as part of the Netflix Marketing organization. As a member of our team, you'll be integral in our mission to provide vision, and help build Netflix into a top global destination for games.

As product marketing director for games, you will help lead a cross-functional team that includes production, brand, creative, marketing and comms to build and execute marketing campaigns for our external games portfolio. You will be responsible for overseeing the overall external game marketing strategy. You accept the unknown and you’re able to come up with groundbreaking initiatives that will take our relationship with members and partners to the next level.

WHAT WE EXPECT

You will partner with the leadership of the Marketing and External Games organizations to build a long-term product roadmap and marketing strategy for the business unit as well as the games, you will establish clear direction and maintain a vision for marketing, brand and content across a portfolio of games and creative products and services. You'll be working closely with creative and product marketing teams to help establish the strategic direction and manage development and execution of the Netflix brand to ensure we deliver a memorable experience globally.

You will provide marketing and brand-centric thinking - partnering with global creative leads, regional marketing partners and external creative agencies on all matters involving Netflix marketing for games.

ACCOUNTABLE FOR

Defining the overall marketing strategy for external games including positioning, goals, priority, budget, innovations and the right opportunities for our games.
Overseeing 60+ games at any one time with holistic marketing oversight of the portfolio.
Owning go to market plans for each game and how this connects into the broader Netflix product marketing.
Defining roadmaps, deliverables, owners and workback schedules for each event/game and product marketing campaign. 

RESPONSIBILITIES

Collaborate with stakeholders to define and drive the short term and long-range vision for the Netflix Games marketing, specifically for external games.
Create full go to market plans for individual games including overviews, brand bibles (working with brand team) and tool kits.
Outline goals and narrative for each event from a marketing perspective and help to determine approach for each event in collaboration with Creative Production and Comms.
Provide onsite support for events to ensure that the beat is achieving the goals we laid out and developers/producers are supported from a marketing perspective.
Succinctly articulate and write strategies, briefs, memos or any documentation needed to communicate our marketing approach and vision
Support the comms strategy and help to ensure the goals for marketing and comms are aligned. 
Drive brand strategy discussions and collaborate with the creative team to ensure strategic objectives are met
Work closely with many internal teams and external partners, including product developers, researchers, marketing personnel and creative agencies to make sure company brand values and image are followed
Work with all cross-functional teams across Creative Production, Brand, Product, localization, QA, production, game design.

QUALIFICATIONS

At least 10 years of experience in game publishing/marketing; ideally having created successful marketing campaigns for multiple games on a variety of platforms and genres with a focus on F2P Live Service mobile.
Experience working across multiple game marketing functions including community management, social, player support and User acquisition.
Proven experience as a steward of game marketing from a game portfolio perspective with the ability to support our brand vision, position, architecture and achieve overall business goals for games.
Successfully worked on multiple games simultaneously at different stages of development, understanding how to position and create large scale reach and satisfaction for those games.
Experience partnering with product development teams to make insight-informed decisions that impact members 
Able to galvanize and influence teams and partners across departments at all levels
Used multiple agencies and vendors working in concert to create a cohesive product marketing campaign.
Able to collaborate with creatives to create a lasting impression among members.
Have a style that promotes respect, credibility and trust throughout the organization

title: Building Automation Project Engineer
description:
Building Automation Project Engineer

Locations: In this role you can be based in any of the following locations including Raleigh, NC or in Baltimore/DC, MD or in Philadelphia, PA or Norwalk, CT.

About FST Technical Services:

Our firm is going through an exciting period of growth and we are looking to continue to be a trailblazer in the industry while holding true to our core values of Accountability, Collaboration, Expertise, Innovation, Sustainability, Quality and Impact.

Our client base includes working with well-known specialty manufacturing companies.  We support clients who make products in the pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical, medical device, microelectronics, semi-conductor industries.  Our projects include new facilities, renovations, upgrades and troubleshooting and investigation of legacy systems. our success has been a direct reflection of the talent and dedication of our extraordinary team. Simply put - we are looking for great people to join as we head into the exciting new chapter. 

About the job:

A Building Automation Project Engineer is responsible for the planning and execution of multiple projects and resources and serving as a subject matter expert on commissioning and consulting projects of the building’s automatic centralized control systems within a variety of manufacturing environments.

As a Building Automation Project Engineer, you will gain top notch experience supporting projects in the manufacturing and laboratory environments while interfacing with exciting clients in the pharmaceutical, medical device, microelectronics, semi-conductor and medical device industries.  You will be leading projects that ensure reliable processes, promote patient safety and ensure that people live and work in facilities that operate as they are intended.  You will work with facility owners, architects, other engineers, contractors and management companies to develop innovative building automation solutions, tailored to meet the needs of the building and customer.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for managing, scheduling and budgeting assigned projects.
Define, oversee and commission the implementation of technical complex building automation systems
As needed you will serve as a technical expert in troubleshooting and/or system definition
Provide detailed information on the design and operation to clients and field installation team
Review submitted materials including DDC modules, field sensing and control devices to meet specifications and standards
Inform other project engineers and senior project engineers regarding staff scheduling.
As appropriate, provide troubleshooting and technical support on a variety of capital projects related to the construction and renovation of manufacturing and laboratory spaces, new / upgraded utility and infrastructure systems, and controls related projects. 
Serve as an Owner’s Project Manager on new construction and upgrades within the life sciences and related industries.
Executing and managing commissioning tasks within time budgeted
Maintain relations with existing clients on assigned projects.
Support the engineering manager in the training and mentoring of team members on proper documentation development, field procedures and equipment usage.
What you’ll need to succeed:

Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical/ Electrical or Industrial Engineering with minimum 5 years of experience in engineering or construction/maintenance related experience
Experience in overseeing and commissioning of automatic centralized control of a building's heating, ventilation and air conditioning, lighting and other systems
At least 3 years’ experience working in or supporting the construction or upgrade of manufacturing or related spaces
Strong knowledge of control theory, automatic temperature controls, building automation systems and other building subsystem
Experience in the integration of low voltage building sub-system
Ability to work safely with hand and power tools and diagnostic tools such as multimeter
EIT or CEM certification preferred
Understanding of FDA regulated industries is desirable.
Hands-on-experience of HVAC and/or electrical systems
Must be physically fit and capable of lifting at least 30 pounds and climbing ladders
Ability to travel to and from various jobsites (within organizations multiple offices a plus!)

title: Lead Operations Dispatcher
description:
Full Job Description
A Full Time Candidate for a Lead Operations Dispatcher for Bldg. #5 91st St. Locals.The hours will be from 10:00AM-7:00PM or until finished dispatching. Pay rate will be based on experience and qualifications.

Western Carriers seeks a full-time, highly motivated, solution-focused Dispatcher with a positive attitude and strong leadership skills to join our Team. The selected candidate MUST HAVE ROADNET (or comparable last-mile routing software) EXPERIENCE and will be responsible for supervising the transportation operations for Metro New York as well as New Jersey, including but not limited to routing, dispatching, and the training and development of new driver hires.

Duties and Responsibilities

ROUTING

· Analyze dynamic/standard routes on an ongoing basis to determine more efficient routes and make any necessary changes.

· Review driver feedback on routes to make any feasible changes to the order/sequence of current routes.

· Make routing decisions in the absence of routers.

· Maintain proper maintenance in RoadNet.

DISPATCH

· Plans the delivery route to be taken by owner operators or their drivers in the delivery and pickup of beverage alcohol to and from WC customers. Determines the needs for routes based off of Logistics schedule of available trucks to most efficiently meet delivery demands and minimize costs.

Incorporates customer delivery demands in terms of delivery time windows.
Follows pickup calendar to assure all pickups are routed accordingly.
· Dispatch owner operators or their drivers timely based off of schedule and route creations, assuring all assets are distributed and time windows are met.

· Completes daily and weekly route reports noting any issues that caused delays along with service metrics not being met.

· Effectively communicates with customers and management to meet the demands of all route requests.

· Monitors daily time window delays and effectively communicates with customer service team of all issues.

· Quick resolution of any issues the drivers encounter while making deliveries.

Assist with updating the information in RoadNet, checking driver and helper assignments to ensure accuracy for each route, and updating departure and completion times on daily reports.
Prepare daily reports for the day, confirming assignments with the Locals Manager.
Answer phone calls and emails from customers, customer service, drivers, regarding delivery times and any issues with deliveries.
Handle call-outs from drivers and driver helpers, providing alternate solutions for deliveries and communicate absences and vacation requests with the Delivery Manager and Accounting in a timely fashion.
Provide communications to Owner Operators, their drivers and their helpers.
Report accidents and breakdowns to fleet and transportation.
Train Drivers on use of Mobilecast and troubleshoot drivers log on and stop issues.
OTHER DUTIES

· Schedule and maintain appointments for deliveries.

· Coach drivers and helpers, as needed, to improve performance and adherence to company policies.

· Advise Owner Operators, their drivers or their helpers when there is a departure from the company’s policies, procedures and protocols. Issue a warning to Owner Operators and/or their employees for any failure to comply with company policies and inform the non-compliant Owner Operator that any continued violations will subject the Owner Operator’s contract to be terminated.

· Responsible for identifying and recommending changes in departmental policies and practices.

· Maintain continuous contact with customers or vendors requiring the provision of services, explanations, decisions, or the obtaining of routine approvals.

· Report driver accidents/incidents to the Locals Manager.

· Other duties as assigned.

Essential Job Requirements

· Working knowledge of RoadNet (or comparable last-mile routing program).

· English language proficient.

· Spanish language a plus.

· Good written and verbal communication skills.

· Microsoft Office competency preferred.

· Must be detail-oriented with good follow-up skills.

· Excellent organizational skills.

· Must be able to multi-task and handle a busy workload in order to meet strong deadlines.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $24.00 - $26.00 per hour

401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Referral program
Vision insurance
Schedule:

8 hour shift
Day shift
Holidays

title: Assistant Director of Facilities
description:
General Information
Job Title:
Assistant Director of Facilities
Location:
8825 SW Barnes Rd
Portland, OR, 97225
United States
Base Pay:
$65000.00 - $75000.00 / Year
Employee Type:
1.0
Manage Others:
Yes
Contact Information
Name:
Human Resources Department
Phone:
503-297-1894 ext 5080
Email:
HumanResources@catlin.edu
Description
Catlin Gabel School seeks to employ the best qualified individuals from available applicants and to provide them with opportunity for advancement in a manner that does not discriminate because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected under local, state, or federal equal employment opportunity laws or regulations.

 

The School believes that each employee makes a significant contribution to the school’s success. That contribution should not be limited by the assigned responsibilities. Therefore, this position description is designed to outline primary duties, qualifications, and job scope, but not limit the incumbent nor the organization to just the work identified. It is our expectation that each employee will offer their services wherever and whenever necessary to ensure the success of our endeavors.



Review of applications begins immediately, and position is open until filled.  This position has an anticipated start date for March 15, 2023.



POSITION SUMMARY

The Assistant Director of Facilities role is to plan, organize, direct, and control the daily operations of maintenance, event support, and custodial operations, safely and efficiently supporting school functions and the physical plant.  There is considerable independence in the execution of day-to-day work and the development of management systems. The Assistant Director collaborates closely with the Director, Grounds and Transportation Supervisors, and Resource Coordinator to provide leadership among the Facilities Team, complete maintenance and event projects, and to act decisively in matters of campus safety/security and in times of emergency.  This is an active position that requires learning the specifics of Catlin Gabel’s campus and applying best practices for efficient maintenance and high performing teams.

 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES

Lead and direct a team of maintenance technicians, day porters, and contracted custodians to maintain the physical plant and support athletic and school events throughout the year
Along with other supervisors, cultivate a culture of service and develop direct reports into a collaborative Facilities team with individual integrity and ownership of their roles
Develop complete and detailed work plans from minimal or unspecific requests
Receive and fulfill requests for furniture and furnishings with consideration of ergonomics, equity, and budget; manage Capital Budget for furnishings
Interface with the school community to develop understanding and cooperation in scheduling and execution of maintenance work orders and preventive maintenance tasks; assist Director with major project coordination and scheduling
Coordinate outside contractors and manage contracts/documentation for projects under $10,000, or as assigned by the Director, to optimize work efficiency and minimize impacts on school community
Schedule and document safety inspections of buildings and equipment for hazards and violations of safety codes
Maximize the use of FMX work order database daily; track data on utilities, equipment service logs, time to resolution, parts inventory, etc. and prepare reports for Director
Maintain the Safety Data Sheet database in partnership with members of the staff and faculty
Participate in annual budgeting process; monitor maintenance budget and process invoices
Become familiar with campus energy management software and HVAC systems by end of year one
Assess and implement shop organization, purchasing, and inventory system for maintenance equipment and supplies by end of year one
Act in role of Director and lead maintenance, grounds, and transportation teams when Director is not available
Attend departmental and schoolwide employee meetings
Participate in required professional development and training to support Catlin Gabel mission
 

OTHER DUTIES

Actively support the school through participation in the variety of activities that make the Catlin Gabel School a vibrant community
Conduct safety drills and other emergency practices as part of the Crisis Management Team
Serves on the Safety Committee
Complete other work as assigned by Director of Facilities
 

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITES

Oversee the daily workflow, scheduling, and assignments of a team of 4-6 day porters and 3-5 maintenance technicians
Coach employees to create and maintain an integrated work environment of respect, good morale, ownership, and collaboration
Coordinate and maintain documentation of required training of direct reports; seek opportunities for additional training and skill building to enable professional growth and foster promotions within Facilities
Conduct performance evaluations that are timely and constructive with an emphasis on service, professional development, and competencies
May occasionally direct work of volunteers or students
 

INTERPERSONAL CONTACTS

This role requires daily interaction and cooperation with the Facilities Team, faculty, and staff.
There is regular contact with students, parents, vendors, and visitors.
 

COMPETENCIES

Situational awareness and ability to assess risks of conducting maintenance operations in a school environment
Strong leadership abilities that engender, by example and direction, caring customer service, professionalism, a strong work ethic, integrity, and teamwork; proactive and positive team member
Ability to work autonomously and collaboratively within a team
Strong attention to detail and ability to change focus quickly
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute multiple tasks in a high-pressure environment
Interpersonal communication skills to interact effectively with a diverse and multicultural group of people
Exceptional organizational and time management skills utilizing technology and software to enhance efficiency of operations, resource use, and documentation
Committed to safety and sustainability in all aspects of facilities maintenance and school support
Advanced computer skills to use Word, Excel, Outlook, and online work order, inventory, and energy management systems
Strong communication skills, both oral and written to communicate with a broad array of constituents
Ability to receive and provide feedback in a constructive manner
Experience with the safe and proper use of shop tools and diagnostic equipment, lock out tag out procedures, personal protective equipment, and ladders
Ability to operate vehicles, including van, golf cart, and toolcat; ability to learn operation of miscellaneous equipment including tractor, lifts, and motorized equipment
 

WORKING CONDITIONS AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

The requirements listed below are representative of physical requirements and may not be all-encompassing.  Incumbents must be able to perform job duties with or without accommodations. 

Work is performed primarily in multiple buildings throughout school campus, with some outdoor work required on occasion.  Duties are performed in office, shop, and field environments daily.
Consistent movement around campus by foot or mobilized machine; includes stairs and hills between buildings multiple times throughout the workday
Occasionally work may be performed in small spaces or from platforms and ladders to evaluate building conditions, troubleshoot building systems, and assist team as needed
Frequent bending, squatting, stooping, lifting, pushing, pulling, carrying, and kneeling
Frequent lifting and moving of materials, including furniture, ladders, and equipment; must be able to lift and carry 50 pounds for short distances
Must be able to work around moving machinery with exposure to marked changes in noise, temperature, and humidity, and dust, fumes, and gases; works in outdoor weather conditions as necessary
Occasional operation of lifts, tractors, and other rental equipment to assist in special projects and snow removal operations
Duties are performed in office, shop, and field environments daily.
All Facilities Team members are considered essential staff and are expected to respond to emergencies and inclement weather conditions.  This includes power outages and snow and ice removal as needed
 

SCHEDULE

This is a full-time, 12-month position. Hours are typically 7am to 4pm with evening and weekends as required.  The person in this role carries work phone after hours.  This position requires ability to adapt readily to constantly shifting work scenarios within tight timelines and multiple constraints. 



Requirements
At least three years of progressively responsible experience maintaining large, multi-use buildings with preference given to experience in school or institutional setting
At least five years of experience supervising multiple maintenance technicians
Working knowledge of physical plant utilities, structures, equipment, and Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS)
Familiarity with utility and building drawings and documents for use in troubleshooting and recordkeeping
Experience with workplace regulatory environment including OSHA, NFPA, and ADA; preferred knowledge of EPA IAQ, ASHRAE, and APPA training and recommendations
Possession of a valid Oregon driver’s license and an approved driving record

title: Plumber
companyName: City of Sacramento Department of Public Works
description:
THE POSITION
The City of Sacramento requires all newly appointed employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Candidates seeking an accommodation from this requirement will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

IDEAL CANDIDATE STATEMENT

The ideal Plumber candidate must be a skilled tradesperson, proficient in installing and maintaining piping systems in residential and commercial settings. The candidate will be skilled in installing and maintaining a variety of plumbing systems for water, sewer, gas, and pneumatic systems. The ideal candidate will be familiar and proficient in using a variety of tools and equipment used in maintaining plumbing infrastructures. Additionally, the candidate will have skill in gluing, brazing, soldering all types of pipes including, copper, galvanized, PVC, ABS to name a few.  This candidate will be able to read blueprints and schematics, work in a team setting and autonomously, and must be able to work in multiple environments and tight spaces.

This is skilled work of journey-level in the safe and legal installation, maintenance, and repair of plumbing systems in and around City buildings and grounds or on private property where such work is the City's responsibility. The work involves performance of a variety of plumbing tasks in installing, maintaining, repairing, and servicing all types of fixtures and equipment. Almost all work is performed independently. Work assignments are received orally or through written work orders and work may be inspected on completion for conformity to instructions and quality of work.

DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS

The class of Plumber performs journey-level plumbing duties under general supervision and is distinguished from the next lower class of Plumber Apprentice in that the latter performs semi-skilled work in a training capacity under close supervision. Under this training concept positions assigned to the Plumber class may be filled at the Plumber Apprentice level and advancement occurs after the incumbent is substantially performing the full range of duties and meets the qualification standards of the Plumber class. Plumber is distinguished from the next higher class of Senior Plumber in that the latter provides lead supervision.

SUPERVISION RECEIVED AND EXERCISED

General supervision is provided by a Senior Plumber or Mechanical Maintenance Supervisor.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
EXAMPLES OF DUTIES

Depending upon assignment, duties may include, but are not limited to, the following:

- Install, maintain, and repair residential and commercial plumbing, steam and hot water systems complete with all fixtures, hot and cold waterlines, and waste, vent, and sewer lines.
- Install, maintain, and repair compressed air lines including compressor and hose reels.
- Install, maintain, and repair fire sprinkler systems, piping for swimming pools, wading pools, pumps, filters, and related equipment.
- Install, maintain, and repair septic tanks and leach lines and underground irrigation systems including circulating pumps.
- Test, maintain, repair fuel or storage tanks, product lines, vent and vapor recovery lines, and product pumps and dispensers.
- Operate pipe cutters, reamers, threading machines, sewer machines, and other plumbing tools and equipment.
- Keep records of work and make reports.
- Perform related duties as required.

QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge of:

- Standard tools, methods, practices, and materials of the plumbing trade.
- Prevailing plumbing codes.
- Hazards and safety precautions of the work.

Ability to:

- Learn California underground storage tank regulations by the California State Water Resources Control Board.
- Make simple time and material estimates.
- Understand and work from general instructions and specifications, and to follow blueprints and sketches.
- Read and write English at a level necessary for efficient job performance.
- Use the tools, materials, and equipment used in the plumbing trade.

Experience and Education:

Three years of experience as a journey-level plumber after the completion of a 4 year plumber's apprenticeship program. Additional years of experience may substitute for the apprenticeship program on a year-for-year basis.

OR

Four years of experience as a Plumber Apprentice with the City of Sacramento and satisfactory completion of four semester courses (12 units) of training from an accredited school in Basic Theory, Use of Tools, Job Safety and Health, Theory and Practice of Welding and Cutting, Principles and Practices of Water Supply and Gas, Drainage, and Basic Drawing. Courses must be approved by the Joint Apprenticeship Committee for the Plumbing and Pipefitting Industry and the State Division of Apprenticeship Standards. A Plumber Apprentice must also pass the Joint Apprenticeship Committee exam before advancing to the Plumber classification.

PROOF OF EDUCATION
 
Should education be used to qualify for this position, then proof of education such as, but not limited to, university/college transcripts and degrees should be submitted with your application and will be required at the time of appointment. Unofficial documents and/or copies are acceptable. 
 
An applicant with a college degree obtained outside the United States must have education records evaluated by a credentials evaluation service.  Evaluation of education records will be due at time of appointment.

Driver License:

Possession of a valid California Class C Driver License at the time of appointment. Loss of the Class C License is cause for discipline. Individuals who do not meet this requirement due to physical disability will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.

Residency Requirement:

Employees in this classification must reside within thirty-five (35) air miles from the freeway interchange at W-X Streets, 29th - 30th Streets within one year following appointment.


PROBATIONARY PERIOD:

Employees must complete twelve (12) months of probation at a satisfactory performance level prior to gaining permanent status.

THE SELECTION PROCEDURE
Please note, the City of Sacramento's preferred method of communication with applicants is via e-mail. As such, please ensure you verify the e-mail address on your application, and check your e-mail frequently, including your spam and junk folders. All e-mail notifications can also be accessed through the governmentjobs.com applicant inbox.
  
 1. Application: (Pass/Fail) – All applicants must complete and submit online a City of Sacramento employment application to the Employment Office by the final filing deadline;

Employment applications must be submitted online; paper applications will not be accepted. 
Employment applications will be considered incomplete and will be disqualified: 
If applicants do not list current and past job-related experience in the duties area of the "Work Experience" section. Note: Qualifying experience is based on full-time experience (40 hours per week). Qualifying experience is calculated to the full-time equivalent (pro-rated if less than 40 hours/week).
If "see resume" is noted in the "Work Experience" section; a resume will not substitute for the information required in the "Work Experience" section. 
Proof of education such as, but not limited to, university/college transcripts and degrees should be submitted online with your application. Proof of education will be required at time of appointment
Position/job titles will not be considered in determining eligibility for meeting the minimum qualifications for this position. 
If you’re requesting Veteran’s credit, a copy of your DD214 must be submitted online with your application, delivered in person, or sent to the Employment Office by email/fax or mailed by the final filing deadline. Information regarding the use of Veteran’s credit can be found in the Civil Service Board rules under rule 4.9C.
Applicants are responsible for attaching a copy of their DD214 to each position for which they apply.
 2.Screening Committee: (Pass/Fail)– Human Resources will evaluate employment applications for the minimum qualifications stated on the job announcement.
 
3. Screening For Most Qualified: (Pass/Fail) – In the event of a large candidate pool, each candidate's Work Experience section of the application will be evaluated and rated. Only those candidates determined to be the most qualified will proceed to the next step in the selection process. A resume will not substitute for the information required in the Work Experience section of the application.

 4. Performance Test: (Weighted 100%) – Qualified candidates will be notified by email of the test date, time, and location approximately one to two weeks prior to the test. The performance test will be job related and may include, but not limited to, the knowledge and abilities as outlined above.
TEST EXEMPTION - If you have previously taken the Plumber exam within the past year of the final filing date of this posting, you may be considered exempt from taking the Plumber Exam. 
The City of Sacramento’s Human Resources Department will verify applicant’s eligibility at the time of the final filing deadline of this job posting.

 5.Eligibility- Candidates who pass the performance test will be placed on an eligible list. The hiring department may contact those on the eligible list for an interview at any time during the life of the one-year list. Candidate’s eligibility expires year from the date of notification of a passing score for the Plumber examination. Candidates can take the examination at any time to maintain eligibility. 
If you are currently on an active eligible list for the Plumber classification, it is unnecessary to retake the examination. 
The eligible list is effective one year from the date of passing the examination for the Plumber.  
If you are hired from the eligible list you will no longer have active status on the eligible list per Civil Service Board Rule, 5.7(i). Applicants interested in maintaining their eligibility will need to take and pass the exam after their hire date.
 6.Conditional Hire: Upon receipt of a conditional offer, the selected candidate must complete and pass LiveScan / fingerprinting; and provide proof of receiving a complete COVID-19 vaccination, review by Human Resources, a pre-employment controlled substance and / or alcohol test, and possess any required licensure or certification prior to receiving a start date from the Department. Failure to meet these prerequisites will be grounds for withdrawal of your conditional offer of employment.
   
QUESTIONS:
 For questions concerning this job announcement and the application process:
Please visit https://www.governmentjobs.com/Home/ApplicationGuide for a comprehensive, step-by-step guide to the application process. 
For technical support between 6 AM - 5 PM PT, contact Live Applicant Support at (855) 524-5627. 
Visit the City of Sacramento Human Resources Department website at http://www.cityofsacramento.org/HR/Career-Opportunities; 
Send an email to employment@cityofsacramento.org; 
Call the Human Resources Department at (916) 808-5726
